duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and implement individualized dental care plans for patients.
Perform patient education, discharge planning, and patient/family teaching under the supervision of a qualified dentist.
Assess dental conditions and needs of patients, including medical history review, dental charting, and perio charting.
Deliver direct patient care, including routine treatment procedures such as cleaning, polishing, x-rays, application of sealants and fluorides.
Document dental history or chief complaint; record and report observations, patient reactions, and lab procedures.
Assist with or institute emergency measures for sudden adverse developments during treatment.
Provide supervision of or training for students assigned to Neighborcare Health as part of their professional education.
Work in partnership and joint accountability with other team members to achieve Neighborcare's Mission, Guiding Principles, Service Commitments, and Goals.

education_certification.credential: Completed an accredited dental hygiene program
Active Dental Hygiene license with the Washington State Department of Health
